gene.function: FUNCTION: Part of the AP-3 complex, an adaptor-related complex which is not clathrin-associated. The complex is associated with the Golgi region as well as more peripheral structures. It facilitates the budding of vesicles from the Golgi membrane and may be directly involved in trafficking to lysosomes. Involved in process of CD8+ T-cell and NK cell degranulation (PubMed:26744459). In concert with the BLOC-1 complex, AP-3 is required to target cargos into vesicles assembled at cell bodies for delivery into neurites and nerve terminals (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O54774, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26744459}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Golgi apparatus membrane {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane protein {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}.
geneOntologyBiologicalProcess: antigen processing and presentation, exogenous lipid antigen via MHC class Ib [GO:0048007]
neurotransmitter receptor transport, postsynaptic endosome to lysosome [GO:0098943]
positive regulation of NK T cell differentiation [GO:0051138]
regulation of sequestering of zinc ion [GO:0061088]
